Interlingua: C, c before e, i, or y

International Phonetic Alphabet: Close-mid front unrounded vowel or Close-mid front unrounded vowel

Interlingua: C,c; Ch,ch Q,q; K,k   (Q,q almost always appears before U,u)

International Phonetic Alphabet: Close-mid back rounded vowel or Close-mid back rounded vowel
Voiceless velar plosive Voiceless velar plosive or Voiceless velar plosive Voiceless velar plosive

Interlingua: S, s; optionally C, c before i, e, y
Ch, ch; Sh, sh (Sh, sh is rare)

Ido: W, w; U, u (before a vowel)
Interlingua: U, u; W, w (W, w is rare)

International Phonetic Alphabet: Voiceless velar plosive Voiceless velar plosive or Voiceless velar plosive Voiceless velar plosive

Ido: Y, y; I, i (before a vowel)
